Change-Id: I5aef9ae5968a1fc955f01317bc99f17e96cdc407
Closes-bug: #1292192
'}]
commit_message:
NSX: router-interface-add returns 404 if router not found in nsx

Previously, neutron would return a 404 error when attaching a subnet
to a router where the router did not exist in nsx. In this case
we should not return a 404 but instead succeed and set the router
port status to error same as we do in the case when create ports
on networks that do not exist in nsx.

Change-Id: I5aef9ae5968a1fc955f01317bc99f17e96cdc407
Closes-bug: #1292192

subject: Make auth plugins dest save to os_
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-15 05:21:21.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/auth/base.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/auth/test_cli.py'], 'message': "Make auth plugins dest save to os_

If the auth plugin saves into the normal namespace like .user_id and
user_id is an argument of the command then the two argument collide with
each other.

This is fairly common, particularly in keystoneclient's shell.

There is a little bit of a compatibility concern in that the variables
on the returned namespace have changed, however the usage of this
function should be if you use register_argparse_arguments you should
also use load_from_argparse_arguments and that is not changed.

Change-Id: Id1cb0983a1e78661492acd78ad9aa67ff8d49250
"}]
commit_message:
Make auth plugins dest save to os_

If the auth plugin saves into the normal namespace like .user_id and
user_id is an argument of the command then the two argument collide with
each other.

This is fairly common, particularly in keystoneclient's shell.

There is a little bit of a compatibility concern in that the variables
on the returned namespace have changed, however the usage of this
function should be if you use register_argparse_arguments you should
also use load_from_argparse_arguments and that is not changed.

Change-Id: Id1cb0983a1e78661492acd78ad9aa67ff8d49250

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-19 14:39:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/extensions/dynamic_routing.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_extension_dynamic_routing.py', 'neutron/db/dr_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_dynamicrouting_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/15be73214821_add_dynamic_routing_model_data.py', 'etc/policy.json'], 'message': "BGP dynamic routing: add association with entities

BGP basic goal is expose a Neutron API endpoint to let advertise and
discover routes from/to uplink peers.

AdvertiseRoute extends Route and is used to advertise routes through a
routing peer. As ExtraRoutes does with the Router entity, this
functionality is available through the update_routingpeer method. So
advertise routes are modified altogether.

A new binding between routing peer and router is added. The associated
router will be the entity that will 'learn' discovered routes from uplinks.

Change-Id: Ib13934b749270fc2cda7178cd2a81a8805d6eb8d
Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing
"}]
commit_message:
BGP dynamic routing: add association with entities

BGP basic goal is expose a Neutron API endpoint to let advertise and
discover routes from/to uplink peers.

AdvertiseRoute extends Route and is used to advertise routes through a
routing peer. As ExtraRoutes does with the Router entity, this
functionality is available through the update_routingpeer method. So
advertise routes are modified altogether.

A new binding between routing peer and router is added. The associated
router will be the entity that will 'learn' discovered routes from uplinks.

Change-Id: Ib13934b749270fc2cda7178cd2a81a8805d6eb8d
Partially-Implements: blueprint bgp-dynamic-routing

commit_message:
Fixes an issue with the XMLEquals matcher

The matcher implementation would fail to match two documents that are
semantically equivalent, but sibling elements appear in different
document order.

Change-Id: I99dc6401e73be4c61bb265c3258b6245f2e7bb34
Closes-bug: #1347891

subject: Recover from errors while deleting image segments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-18 22:04:06.000000000', 'files': ['glance/store/swift.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py'], 'message': "Recover from errors while deleting image segments

When Glance attempts to delete an image, which is stored as a
segmented object, if an error occurs while deleting one of the
segments, delete operation fails while leaving behind rest of
the segments.

This patch enables Glance to recover from one or more errors during
segment deletion and proceed with deleting other segments. However,
this patch doesn't do anything with the failed segments themselves.
With this patch it'd be possible that even after an image is
deleted, certain chunks are left behind in the store.

Change-Id: Id1dde6655f48672a9b9f1253a6980ca7a9402db2
Closes-Bug: 1256364
"}]
commit_message:
Recover from errors while deleting image segments

When Glance attempts to delete an image, which is stored as a
segmented object, if an error occurs while deleting one of the
segments, delete operation fails while leaving behind rest of
the segments.

This patch enables Glance to recover from one or more errors during
segment deletion and proceed with deleting other segments. However,
this patch doesn't do anything with the failed segments themselves.
With this patch it'd be possible that even after an image is
deleted, certain chunks are left behind in the store.

Change-Id: Id1dde6655f48672a9b9f1253a6980ca7a9402db2
Closes-Bug: 1256364

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 7226, 'name': 'Stan Lagun', 'email': 'stan.lagun@gmail.com', 'username': 'istalker2'}, {'_account_id': 7562, 'name': 'Dmitry Teselkin', 'email': 'dteselkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dteselkin'}, {'_account_id': 7600, 'name': 'Ruslan Kamaldinov', 'email': 'rkamaldinov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ruhe'}, {'_account_id': 7821, 'name': 'Murano CI', 'username': 'murano-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8040, 'name': 'Timur Sufiev', 'email': 'tsufiev@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsufiev'}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}, {'_account_id': 10063, 'name': 'Steve McLellan', 'email': 'steven.j.mclellan@gmail.com', 'username': 'sjmc7'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-08-19 08:49:59.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/lhs_expression.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_assignments.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/meta/SampleClass1.yaml'], 'message': "LHS assignment expressions didn't work with non-trivial indexation

Most of assignment expressions involving indexation operator except
for the most trivial one fail.

For example the following failed:

$myDict[$keyName]: value
$myDict['A']['B']: value (even if $myDict['A'] is a dictionary)
$myList[2 + 2]: value
$myList[$index]: value

This commit adds support for sub-expressions within LHS-expressions

Change-Id: I4b72e85b5f9bda04c6156d5c8b07eb8f5358643d
Closes-Bug: #1358545
"}]
commit_message:
LHS assignment expressions didn't work with non-trivial indexation

Most of assignment expressions involving indexation operator except
for the most trivial one fail.

For example the following failed:

$myDict[$keyName]: value
$myDict['A']['B']: value (even if $myDict['A'] is a dictionary)
$myList[2 + 2]: value
$myList[$index]: value

This commit adds support for sub-expressions within LHS-expressions

Change-Id: I4b72e85b5f9bda04c6156d5c8b07eb8f5358643d
Closes-Bug: #1358545

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-18 13:32:08.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/lib/murano-dashboard'], 'message': "Make apache restarts a little more forgiving

Apache sometimes is slow to release the port which can cause restarts of apache
to fail due to the requested port already being bound. Make use of the function
'restart_apache_server' added to fix #1342256, which introduces a small sleep
between the stop and start to help make apache deployments a bit more resilient.

Closes-Bug: #1358281

Change-Id: Ic4206f24d7bb04b014b3cb179d2303bb301c59d2
"}]
commit_message:
Make apache restarts a little more forgiving

Apache sometimes is slow to release the port which can cause restarts of apache
to fail due to the requested port already being bound. Make use of the function
'restart_apache_server' added to fix #1342256, which introduces a small sleep
between the stop and start to help make apache deployments a bit more resilient.

Closes-Bug: #1358281

Change-Id: Ic4206f24d7bb04b014b3cb179d2303bb301c59d2

commit_message:
Improve benchmarking tool

This commit adds several enhancements to benchmarking tool: server_url
and path to messages now can be configured in config file.  Default
output of program has been changed: now it prints values in json so they
can be parsed more easily. Previous human readable representation is
accessible via --verbose flag.

The `total_requests` metric now shows all performed requests (either
failed or successful) and new metric - `successful_requests` - was
introduced to store count of successful requests.

Change-Id: Id6fe4b2046394a348ba07eb5b2b003c6024b78b0
Partially-implements: blueprint gen-bench-reports

commit_message:
labs: quotation marks around variables

It is generally a good idea to keep variables within quotation marks,
even if we don't expect the value to ever contain whitespace.

Also, it makes automated test tools (shellcheck) happy.

Change-Id: I1c323a1dd10087694312892eac3c11cf54e07ce4

subject: Provide useful error early if not enough nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-07-24 18:50:21.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_testenv.sh', 'scripts/devtest.sh'], 'message': "Provide useful error early if not enough nodes

Change Icff5e728148f2744f3fc7c6e99d744be9fda180b set the number of
nodes created for a test environment to a fixed value.

Document the reason for the change, and also error early if not enough
nodes are created, so that we don't unnecessarily waste developer time
debugging the failure of an overcloud deploy due to lack of resources.

Change-Id: I93c09e1905ca4eb6e9e580ecd0e9d4b8fcf1339e
"}]
commit_message:
Provide useful error early if not enough nodes

Change Icff5e728148f2744f3fc7c6e99d744be9fda180b set the number of
nodes created for a test environment to a fixed value.

Document the reason for the change, and also error early if not enough
nodes are created, so that we don't unnecessarily waste developer time
debugging the failure of an overcloud deploy due to lack of resources.

Change-Id: I93c09e1905ca4eb6e9e580ecd0e9d4b8fcf1339e

subject: Resolved server and instance status redundancy
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-08-19 11:20:55.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/server.py', 'heat/tests/test_nova_client.py', 'heat/engine/clients/os/nova.py', 'heat/engine/resources/instance.py'], 'message': "Resolved server and instance status redundancy

Instance and server resource's _check_active() methods were
stripping off an extra '(STATUS)' string from the status.
This change moves the code of consistently handling status
to the nova client in heat. So, both the resources need not
perform any exra stuff to determine the status.

Change-Id: Ib527c001a2cdae90de1545ccdd56ad722c724d07
"}]
commit_message:
Resolved server and instance status redundancy

Instance and server resource's _check_active() methods were
stripping off an extra '(STATUS)' string from the status.
This change moves the code of consistently handling status
to the nova client in heat. So, both the resources need not
perform any exra stuff to determine the status.

Change-Id: Ib527c001a2cdae90de1545ccdd56ad722c724d07

commit_message:
Fix Neutron core_plugin selection and NSX_OVS installation

* Add if statement for NSX
* Fix a string substitution in plugin_neutronnsx/manifests/alter_neutron_server.pp
* Run plugin_neutronnsx::install_ovs in Stage 'netconfig' to avoid circular dependancies

Closes-bug: #1358255

commit_message:
Adds KMIPSecretStore and unit tests

This adds a KMIP implementation of SecretStore. This implementation will use
a KMIP server backend to store secrets. Additionally, this patch adds unit
tests that are in a format similar to the rest of the OpenStack projects.

Implements the SecretStore abstraction from:
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/94710/

Change-Id: Id39b6c84d0990369e2f535f22826cd41708a2f63
Implements blueprint kmip-secret-store

commit_message:
Disable hacking rule H305

This commit disables the H305 rule because it is inconsistent between
python releases. Additionally while the logical grouping is a good
thing in most cases it can be excessive to enforce sometimes. Having
reviewers attempt to catch it in most cases should be sufficient.

Change-Id: I7530fe2295c4260a20f8cdd1f853611a9a6b2f99

commit_message:
Replace horizon alerting with an angular one

    Horizon alerting is now fully integrated into the angular
application. The object horizon.msg is available in the application
in order to keep the compatibility, it is a link to the new angular
service object.

Change-Id: If52b364eb8f3c0976bd1799a806db1a67431b5f5
Implements: blueprint horizon-angular

commit_message:
engine service add owner_id to create_stack

Adds owner_id as an optional argument to the top-level interface for
handling stack-creates, so it will be possible to create a nested stack
via an RPC call between engines.

Change-Id: I319e0d906d6ad54da6ce782a8a9dd9704f40e225
blueprint: decouple-nested

commit_message:
Partial oslo-incubator sync -- log.py

This patch pulls in the changes in openstack/common/log.py that fix
a problem exposed by the removal of translation from LOG.debug
messages.  This removal causes the messages to no longer be unicode, which
can cause formatting problems.  The changes in log.py ensure that any
message that is not of six.test_type is coverted to six.text_type.

Note that this is required to complete blueprint: i18n-enablement.

Generated with:
python update.py --base nova --dest-dir /opt/stack/nova --modules log

log:
 759bd87 Merge "Set keystonemiddleware and routes.middleware to log on WARN l
 71d072f Merge "Except socket.error if syslog isn't running"
 37c0091 Add unicode coercion of logged messages to ContextFormatter
 6614413 Correct coercion of logged message to unicode
 1188d88 Except socket.error if syslog isn't running
 ac995be Fix E126 pep8 errors
 36e5c2d Merge "Adjust oslo logging to provide adapter is enabled for"
 631f880 Set keystonemiddleware and routes.middleware to log on WARN level
 726d00a Adjust oslo logging to provide adapter is enabled for

Change-Id: I255a68fc60963386e8fefe65c3ffd269795adbf4
Closes-Bug: 1348244

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-21 14:09:56.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/configure-vm', 'templates/vm.xml'], 'message': "Get rid of overspecification in vm.xml.

We don't need to pass the appropriate qemu binary into the vm template,
as libvirt will inject the proper one for us.  Similarly, we don't need
to tell libvirt what specific model of PC hardware to emulate, because
it will pick one that is appropriate to the devices we specify.

Change-Id: Id3762cce9b2ba9f96c1e7e79fad9a4bf8770bf7a
"}]
commit_message:
Get rid of overspecification in vm.xml.

We don't need to pass the appropriate qemu binary into the vm template,
as libvirt will inject the proper one for us.  Similarly, we don't need
to tell libvirt what specific model of PC hardware to emulate, because
it will pick one that is appropriate to the devices we specify.

Change-Id: Id3762cce9b2ba9f96c1e7e79fad9a4bf8770bf7a

proxy user. This user will be used as a delegate for trusts involving
accessing Swift objects. In the absence of a proxy user, the default
admin user will be used.

Changes
* adding entries for Swift proxy user in sahara.conf.sample
* adding keystone functions to get a proxy user client
* renaming older admin based client functions

commit_message:
Adding configuration options for Swift proxy user

This change adds a new configuration option and functions for a Swift
proxy user. This user will be used as a delegate for trusts involving
accessing Swift objects. In the absence of a proxy user, the default
admin user will be used.

Changes
* adding entries for Swift proxy user in sahara.conf.sample
* adding keystone functions to get a proxy user client
* renaming older admin based client functions
* adding base method for admin and proxy keystone client acquisition

Partial-implements: blueprint edp-swift-trust-authentication
Change-Id: I62ba89778e3faa0041823a54e96d3af0f6c5c66a

commit_message:
Install of a Barbican RPM fails due to missing keystonemiddleware

keystonemiddleware (a dependency added recently) is not yet in RDO but
is a dependency for Barbican, and therefore needs to be FPM-ed via the
rpmbuild/package_dependencies.sh script.

Closes-Bug: #1356574
Change-Id: Iab1879d5529b45ddcfdb28224cba55fdd06d0205

commit_message:
Prevent tenant viewing volumes owed by another

Bug introduced by 0505bb268942534ad5d6ecd5e34a4d9b0e7f5c04 allows any
tenant to get the details of a volume belonging to any other tenant
if the UUID is known.

This commit allows only the tenant or an admin to get a volume.

Change-Id: I0268d374f7529d89068dcbf3c1cb9ab3d60d4115
Closes-Bug: #1356368

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-08-12 21:38:15.000000000', 'files': ['elements/haproxy/install.d/76-haproxy'], 'message': 'Add workaround for reloading haproxy on Fedora

We want to be able to reload haproxy, but the upstream service file
for haproxy fails when we do.  This overwrites the upstream service
file with a fixed one that will eventually be added to the upstream
package.

Change-Id: I63bca52d7601850de87456fbb221a8400c6933aa
Related-Bug: 1348931
'}]
commit_message:
Add workaround for reloading haproxy on Fedora

We want to be able to reload haproxy, but the upstream service file
for haproxy fails when we do.  This overwrites the upstream service
file with a fixed one that will eventually be added to the upstream
package.

Change-Id: I63bca52d7601850de87456fbb221a8400c6933aa
Related-Bug: 1348931

commit_message:
Remove LVM driver

Support of LVM driver is planned to be dropped as it is duplicates
functionality from Cinder. Default driver is Generic driver, that uses Cinder.

Changes:
- removed LVM driver
- removed related stuff to LVM driver

Partially implements blueprint remove-lvm-driver
Change-Id: If2df592db082fdc5d609a5ce644106fee7d0583d

subject: Remove cinder-volume from controller image.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-19 06:43:09.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_overcloud.sh'], 'message': 'Remove cinder-volume from controller image.

The cinder-volume element will be installed as dep by either
cinder-tgt or cinder-lio. We do not want it to be deployed on the
controller nodes if one opts to use external BlockStorage nodes
and as such does not use cinder-{tgt,lio} on the controller.

Change-Id: I3d8f1af2866db5e9d061a5481eea865ba7d8b94c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove cinder-volume from controller image.

The cinder-volume element will be installed as dep by either
cinder-tgt or cinder-lio. We do not want it to be deployed on the
controller nodes if one opts to use external BlockStorage nodes
and as such does not use cinder-{tgt,lio} on the controller.

Change-Id: I3d8f1af2866db5e9d061a5481eea865ba7d8b94c

subject: Adding 'insert' mode in iter_nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-13 01:18:31.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/server.py'], 'message': "Adding 'insert' mode in iter_nodes

By default iter_nodes will 'shift' nodes if there's failure happen.
With this patch it can insert handoff node to replace the failed
primary. This would save lots of data moving when the node rejoins the
cluster in EC reconstructor. Also disable sort_nodes to keep the
fragment archives' seqence the same as the node sequence in the ring.

Change-Id: I2f66fb17123a20f6d96bf0673af237efbc9e6e2e
"}]
commit_message:
Adding 'insert' mode in iter_nodes

By default iter_nodes will 'shift' nodes if there's failure happen.
With this patch it can insert handoff node to replace the failed
primary. This would save lots of data moving when the node rejoins the
cluster in EC reconstructor. Also disable sort_nodes to keep the
fragment archives' seqence the same as the node sequence in the ring.

Change-Id: I2f66fb17123a20f6d96bf0673af237efbc9e6e2e

In some cases these commands create log files, running them as the service
user prevents them being owned by root.

commit_message:
Remove the word 'More' in the row actions split button

The split button dropdown doesn't need the term 'More',
the caret icon is enough.  See bug report for example.
(It gives us more room for long primary button names like
'Edit Hosts Aggregate')

Change-Id: Ib789f9c5691cb0cec026ee8d877e6385315b00a7
Closes-Bug: #1357487
